page.title: 19ECOLOGY
page.content: Most of the block is treeless, except round farmsteads, with few hedges between fields. Gorse and broom are predominant in uncultivated places and most of the higher ground has been reclaimed. The river valley is rich in{wildlife:}including duck, moorhens, dippers, game birds, grey wagtails and roedeer. Oyster catchers and lapwings breed in the fields.{Predators}include stoats, weasels, mink, foxes, owls, kestrels, sparrow hawks and carrion crows. Rabbits and pigeons abound and are unpopular with crop producers. Finches,tits,robins,thrushes, sparrows are found in gardens and roadsides; swallows nest in outhouses, and in winter flocks of geese visit stubble fields. Bats colonise the church,rats and mice the barns, hedgehogs the roadside. Salmon, sea and brown trout and eels are in the river.
